attributes.action: Prioritise mental health support in the long term recovery plans from Covid-19.
attributes.additional_details: Covid-19 and the measures taken to deal with it have had a huge effect on mental health. At Good Mental Health we see the results daily and know how much people are going to need support to come out of this. Children will face the impact for years to come, adults have had to adjust to a way of life that will leave emotional scars and frontline workers will be dealing with the impact of things they have faced for the rest of their lives. Institutional support is needed to ensure we move forward.
attributes.background:
We would like the Government to: 
• Ensure that mental health support is as important as the economy as we come out of the Covid crisis.
• Commit to invest in mental health services as opposed to cutting them.
• Publish genuine analysis of the impact that Covid-19 has had on mental health.

rejection.details:
We understand you are concerned about support for mental health as the country recovers from the Covid-19 pandemic. However it's not clear what specific actions you want the Government to take to "ensure that mental health support is as important as the economy as we come out of the Covid crisis".

You could start a petition calling for the Government to fund targeted mental health support for those affected by Covid-19, if that is something you'd like to happen. Alternatively, you could start a petition calling on the Government to commission a review into the impact of the pandemic on mental health in the UK, if that is something you'd like to happen. 

In the meantime you might like to sign the following petitions which call for related actions:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/566536
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557313
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/562359
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/559871

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
